intro: Androsace artvinensis, commonly known as Artvin sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northeastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine, soft hairs. Androsace artvinensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
